item.title: Interlude: Bits of OpenGL, part 2 (Basic Computer Graphics in a Week)
item.description: This is an optional read for BCGIAW. In the first part, we did lots of things that may or may not have made sense. But now, time to actually see something on the screen! And isn’t that fun? Let’s pick up where we left off. Last time we did put something in the GPU memory, but we have no way of actually showing the data we’ve imported in our program.

item.title: Interlude: Bits of OpenGL, part 1 (Basic Computer Graphics in a Week)
item.description: EDIT 31/10/2019: thanks to @deccer for spotting some mistakes and design flaws on this post, they’re now fixed. This is an optional read for BCGIAW. We met our transforms in day two, knew our 3D models in day three and integrated like mad men in day four. How about we put that into practice a little? It’s been some time since I last posted here and it’ll be some time until the next post comes out, too.
